profile.rationale: The job advertisement clearly outlines responsibilities that span both core software engineering practices (e.g., 'code and build working systems,' 'software development life cycle,' 'production ready code,' 'high-quality codebase,' 'full stack,' 'optimising for deployment') and specialized AI/GenAI tasks (e.g., 'create highly realistic... synthetic humans through text-to-video,' 'develop our LLM-based TTS system,' 'model training and inference optimisation,' 'data processing pipelines that will run on very large amounts of data'). The technologies mentioned are all specific to Generative AI (LLMs, TTS, text-to-video models). The role requires ownership of the full ML lifecycle, including development and deployment, and emphasizes collaboration. This blend of strong software engineering fundamentals with a specific focus on Generative AI tasks aligns perfectly with the Core GenAI Engineer profile.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and detailed. It explicitly mentions both software development lifecycle tasks and specific AI/GenAI model development and optimization tasks. The technologies are also clearly stated and fall within the GenAI domain. The responsibilities map directly to the defined categories, making the analysis straightforward and unambiguous.
